alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 12:33AM CDT until March 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Douglas County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern Webster County in southwestern Missouri... Southern Wright County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 1233 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mountain Grove, Ava, Mansfield, Norwood, Brushyknob, Dogwood, Goodhope, Drury and Vanzant. This includes the following low water crossings... Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Wolf Creek at Highway AB, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447, Cowskin Creek at Highway Y, Bryant Creek at Highway U and Fox Creek at County Road 246. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
